#summary Links of Interest for this Project.
#sidebar TableOfContents

[http://www.sportsml.org/ SportML]

SportML is a markup language used to communicate sports results. It is not used for game record, analysis and statistics collection over time. It has different goals and purposes.

[http://www.microformats.org/ Microformats]

Designed for humans first and machines second, microformats are a set of simple, open data formats built upon existing and widely adopted standards.

[http://www.openstreetmap.org/ OpenStreetMap]

[http://www.openstreetmap.org/ OpenStreetMap] is the free wiki world map. It is a natural place to store and retrieve position data for golf courses.

Have a look at the following initiatives:

  * [http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Proposed_features/Golf_course OpenStreetMap effort to include golf data in its layers of information]
  * [http://code.google.com/p/osmgolf The skeleton of a golf application built on top of the above]
  * [https://sites.google.com/site/maps4locus/home/ A tool to build and incorporate golf data into OSM]
